subsection.title: 1. Identify the solution of a system

introduction.p: Recall that a solution to a system makes each equation in the system true.

statement.p: Decide whether (3,-2) is a solution of the system x = 5y+13 2x+3y=0
Find the solution of the system graphed below.

solution.p: The solution must lie on both graphs, so it is the intersection point, P. The coordinates of point P are (50, 1300), so the solution of the system is t=50,~y=1300.

subsection.title: 2. Use the formula for profit, P=R-C

assemblage.title: Profit
assemblage.p: To find the profit earned by a company we subtract the costs from the revenue. \text{Profit} = \text{Revenue} - \text{Cost}~~~~~~~~P=R-C

introduction.p: "Revenue" is the amount of money a company takes in from selling its product. A negative profit is the same as a loss.

statement.p: The owner of a sandwich shop spent $800 last week for labor and supplies. She received $1150 in revenue. What was her profit?

solution.p: We evaluate the formula with R=1150 and C=800 to find P \amp = R-C \amp = 1150 - 800 = 350 The owner's profit was $350.

statement.p: EcoGreen made $1848 profit on low-flow shower heads last year, and spent $3426 in costs. What was their revenue from shower heads?

solution.p: We usse the profit formula and solve the equation 1848 = R - 3246 to find that R=5094. Their revenue was $5094.

introduction.p: Applied problems that involve more than one unknown are often easier to model and solve with a system of equations.

statement.p:
Write equations about the number of tables and the number of chairs:
There are four chairs for each table.
Chairs cost $125 each; a table costs $350. Darryl spent $10,200 on tables and chairs.

solution.p:
Let x be the number of tables and y the number of chairs.
The number of chairs is 4 times the number of tables: ~y=4x.
125y+350x=10,200

statement.p:
Write equations about the dimensions of a rectangle:
The perimeter of the rectangle is 42 meters.
The length is 3 meters more than twice the width.

solution.p:
Let x be the width of the rectangle and y its length.
2x+2y=42
y=3+2x
